data_manager module

class data_manager.DataHandler[source]

Bases: ABC

abstract get(data, key)[source]

Retrieve an item from the given data structure based on the provided key.

Parameters:

  • data (dict or list) – The data structure to retrieve the item from.

  • key (str or int) – The key or index to access the item.

Returns:

The value corresponding to the key or index.

abstract items(data)[source]

Return an iterator over the items in the data structure.

Parameters:

data (dict or list) – The data structure to iterate over.

Returns:

An iterator over the (key, value) pairs for dictionaries or (index, value) pairs for lists.

abstract set(data, key, value)[source]

Set an item in the data structure at the specified key or index.

Parameters:

  • data (dict or list) – The data structure to modify.

  • key (str or int) – The key or index where the value should be set.

  • value – The value to store at the specified location.

class data_manager.DataManager[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for managing data, providing functions for: load, save, get, set, and undo.

Subclasses are created for specific file formats and must support: _load_data and _save_data.

_data

The main data structure being managed (dictionary or list).

Type:

Union[Dict, List]

file_path

Path to the file associated with the data.

Type:

str

directory

Directory containing the file.

Type:

str

unsaved_changes

Indicates if there are unsaved changes in the data.

Type:

bool

snapshots

Stack of snapshots for supporting undo functionality.

Type:

List

max_snapshots

Maximum number of snapshots retained for undo operations.

Type:

int

proxy_mapping

Maps keys to proxy files for granular build system dependencies.

type:

Dict

Methods:

add_proxy(proxy_file, proxy_update_keys)[source]

Add a proxy file and its associated update keys. If any of these keys are updated, they will trigger a touch to this proxy_file. This can be used to improve the granularity of dependencies for build management systems. The build system can set a dependency on the proxy_file which is only updated for a subset of fields in the config file rather than rebuilding from any change to the config file.

Parameters:

  • proxy_file (str) – The file to touch when any associated key is updated.

  • proxy_update_keys (List[str]) – List of keys that trigger a touch to this proxy_file.

create(data: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Create a new config file with the specified data.

Parameters:

data (Dict[str, Any]) – Data to save in the new file.

delete(key)[source]

Remove an item from the data.

Parameters:

key – Key or index of the item to remove.

get(key_or_index, default=None)[source]

Retrieve a value from the data, returning a default if not found.

Parameters:

  • key_or_index – Key or index for the data.

  • default – Default value to return if the key or index is not found.

Returns:

The value associated with the key or index, or the default.

get_open_mode(write=False)[source]

Provides the file mode for the data file. Default is ‘w’ for write mode, ‘r’ for read mode. Override for binary or other modes.

Parameters:

write (bool) – Whether the file is being opened for writing.

Returns:

‘w’ for write mode, ‘r’ for read mode.

Return type:

str

property handler

Initialize the data handler when it’s accessed for the first time. There is a separate data handler for Dict data and List data

init_data(data: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Initialize the data and set the appropriate data handler.

Parameters:

data (Dict[str, Any]) – New data to initialize.

insert(key, value)[source]

Insert a new item into the data.

Parameters:

  • key – Key or index for the new item.

  • value – Value to insert.

items()[source]

Get an iterator over the items in the data.

Returns:

An iterator over the data items.

Return type:

Iterator

load(path)[source]

Load data from the specified file and initialize state. Create an initial snapshot for undo functionality.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to the file to load.

Returns:

True if the file was loaded successfully.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the file does not exist.

  • IOError – If there is an issue reading the file.

  • ValueError – If the file contents are invalid.

save()[source]

Save the current data to the file if it has been modified. Create a snapshot of the data for undo feature.

Returns:

True if the file was saved successfully.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

ValueError – If the file path or data is None.

set(key, value)[source]

Update the data with a new value and touch proxy file if key in proxy list.

Parameters:

  • key – Key for the data.

  • value – New value to set.

snapshot_push()[source]

Push the current state of the data to snapshot stack for undo functionality.

If the maximum number of snapshots is reached, the second oldest snapshot is removed. The oldest is always retained for return to initial state.

snapshot_undo()[source]

Restore the data to the previous state using the snapshot stack.

The first snapshot remains in the stack to always allow undo to initial state.

class data_manager.DictDataHandler[source]

Bases: DataHandler

Implementation of the DataHandler for handling dictionary data structures. Supports both regular and nested dictionary access, as well as indirect key references.

get(data, key)[source]

Retrieve a value from a dictionary, supporting both nested keys, and indirect key references.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The dictionary to retrieve the value from.

  • key (str) – The key to access the value. Supports ‘.’ for nested keys, ‘@’ for

  • keys. (indirect)

Returns:

The value associated with the key, or None if the key is not found.

items(data)[source]

Return an iterator over the key-value pairs in the dictionary.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The dictionary to iterate over.

Returns:

Iterator of (key, value) pairs.

set(data, key, value)[source]

Set a value in a dictionary, supporting nested key paths and indirect key references.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The dictionary to modify.

  • key (str) – The key to set the value at. Supports ‘.’ for nested keys and ‘@’ for

  • keys. (indirect)

  • value – The value to store in the dictionary.

class data_manager.ListDataHandler[source]

Bases: DataHandler

Implementation of the DataHandler for handling list-like data structures. Provides basic get, set, and iteration functionality.

delete(data_list, idx)[source]

Delete the item in the list at the specified index.

Parameters:

  • data_list (list) – The list to modify.

  • idx (int) – The index of the item to delete.

Raises:

  • IndexError – If the index is out of range for deletion.

  • ValueError – If data_list is empty.

get(data, index)[source]

Retrieve an item from a list by index.

Parameters:

  • data (list) – The list to retrieve the item from.

  • index (int) – The index of the item to retrieve.

Returns:

The value at the specified index, or None if the index is out of bounds.

insert(data_list, idx, item)[source]

Insert an item in a list at the specified index.

Parameters:

  • data_list (list) – The list to modify.

  • idx (int) – The index at which to insert the value.

  • item – The value to store at the specified index.

Raises:

  • IndexError – If the index is out of range for insertion.

  • ValueError – If data_list is empty.

items(data)[source]

Return an iterator over the index-value pairs in the list.

Parameters:

data (list) – The list to iterate over.

Returns:

Iterator of (index, value) pairs.

set(data, index, item)[source]

Set an item in a list at the specified index.

Parameters:

  • data (list) – The list to modify.

  • index (int) – The index at which to set the value.

  • item – The item to store at the specified index.

Raises:

  • IndexError – If the index is out of range of the list.

  • ValueError – If data is empty

data_manager.delete(data, idx)[source]

Deletes an item from the list

data_manager.insert(data, idx, value)[source]

Inserts a value into the list

data_manager.touch_file(filename)[source]

Set the file’s modification and access time to the current time.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Path to the file.
